page.title: 01Ryhope and South Grangetown
page.content: The area of{Ryhope & South Grangetown, on the north_east coast, began life as a farming community centred on the village of{Ryhope}and{Grange}Farm. The earliest written record of settlement is to be found in the Boldon Book of 1183.The area was dominated by farming until 1859 when{Ryhope Pit}opened. The population rose rapidly,leading to the expansion of both Ryhope & Grangetown. A large{industrial estate}has recently emerged at{Leechmere,}near Grangetown} (now a suburb of{Sunderland);}but the increase in industrialisation and the emergence of housing estates has not destroyed the beauty of the area.There is still plenty of green belt and farm land; the beach and the dene are very scenic and{Ryhope Pumping Station}is now a working museum. Even the closure of the pit in 1966 has led to the site being transformed into a beauty spot.
